column1: == Portrayal in adaptations ==

1978: The Lord of the Rings (1978 film):
:The Nine are clad in brown and black
column2: and have red eyes. The attack on The Prancing Pony is their deed
column3: not that of any accomplices. After the attack
column5: revealing the black armour and hideous masks they wear beneath their cloaks.

column1: 1980: The Return of the King (1980 film)
:The Nine are skull headed demons
column2: who ride winged horses. The Witch-king himself rides a dragon-like creature
column3: and has no face. Only a suspended crown and two red eyes can be seen. The Nazgûl have the Red Eye of Barad-dûr rather than the emblem of Minas Morgul.

column1: 1981: The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series):
:The role of the Ringwraiths was expanded with material from The Hunt for the Ring.
1982-97: Middle-earth Role Playing:
:The name of the eight
column2: other than Khamûl

column1: 1988: J.R.R. Tolkiens War in Middle Earth:
:The Nazgûl are portrayed as black figures with red eyes and purple mantle.
2001-: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game:
:All the Nazgûl are named - The Witch-king of Angmar
column2: The Dark Marshal
column8: The Tainted and The Knight of Umbar.

column1: 2002: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game)
:Black Riders form a threat in the Shire-stages of the game
column2: where they need to be avoided by the player (in the persona of Frodo Baggins)
column3: and as the end boss for the game (in the persona of Aragorn). They are tall and robed in black

column1: 2001-03: The Lord of the Rings (film series):
:The Nazgûl serve as the suspense in the first half of The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring. Their dialogue is changed; the conversation with Gaffer Gamgee is omitted
column2: and the conversation with Farmer Maggot is reduced. The Nine have an iconic scream
column3: provided by Fran Walsh. Under their robes
column4: they are pale white ghostly creatures.

column1: :After the death of the Witch-king
column2: the other eight are taken out by Eagles and debris from Mount Doom
column4: nothing is told of their individual fates.

column1: 2001-7: The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game:
:The Nazgûl
column2: other than the Witch-king
column3: are given Neo-Elvish titles based on their numbers

column1: *Úlairë Attëa (from atta = 2); Black Predator
column2: Keeper of Dol Guldur

column1: *Úlairë Nelya (from neldë = 3); Black Hunter
column2: Lieutenant of Morgul

column1: *Úlairë Cantëa (from canta = 4); Black Assassin
column2: Lieutenant of Dol Guldur

column1: *Úlairë Lemenya (from lempe = 5); Black Enemy
column2: Lieutenant of Morgul

column1: *Úlairë Enquëa (from enquë = 6); Black Threat
column2: Lieutenant of Morgul

column1: *Úlairë Ostëa sic
column2: later corrected to Úlairë Otsëa (from otso = 7); Black Specter

column1: *Úlairë Toldëa (from tolto = 8); Black Shadow
column2: Messenger of Morgul

column1: *Úlairë Nertëa (from nertë = 9); Black Horseman
column2: Messenger of Dol Guldur

column1: 2004: The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth:
:The Mordor faction has two different Nazgûl units: "Witch-king on Fell Beast" and "Nazgûl on Fell Beast". They are primarily used for scouting and surprise attacks.
File:The Lord of the Rings War in the North - Nazgûl.jpg in The Lord of the Rings: War in the North.
2006: The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II:
:A new Ringwraith is introduced in the expansion pack
column2: The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II: The Rise of the Witch-king. Morgomir is the "Lieutenant of Carn-Dûm"
column3: the right-hand man of the Witch-king
column4: of Black Númenóreans descent. The design is similar to that in Peter Jacksons films: he is hooded and cloaked when he works for the Mordor faction
column5: and white and ghostly when he fights for Angmar.

column1: 2007: The Lord of the Rings Online:

:The Nazgûl appear several times throughout the game. Hobbit characters first witness the Black Riders in the Shire during the Prologue. Early in the game one of the Nine wounds a Dúnedain Ranger Amdir with a Morgul-knife
column2: who is later transformed into a Wraith himself
column3: despite the best efforts of Free Peoples. Later
column4: the player attempts to resist the troubles the Nine are spreading in Bree-Land. Various people along their path - from Hobbits
column6: to people east of Weathertop - note how the local wildlife became unusually aggressive lately
column7: though few connect it to the influence of Nazgûl.

column1: :As stated in The Fellowship of the Ring
column2: only eight horses of the Wraiths were found along the shores of Bruinen. Glorfindel
column4: and his sons all enlist you to find the missing one - and while the horse is eventually found
column5: it is clear that the Nazgûl himself escaped. The player foils his attempts to organize the Trolls of the Trollshaws and pursues him into the Misty Mountains
column6: where the severely weakened Wraith is finally defeated
column7: with his spirit sent back to Mordor.

column1: :During the Fellowships stay in Lothlórien
column2: the Galadhrim Elves launch a military strike against Dol Guldur
column3: to draw the attention of the Eye from the company departing down the Shores of Anduin. At this point
column4: three Nazgûl reside in the fortress; their names are given as "The Black Blade of Lebennin"
column5: "The Gloom of Nurn" and the strongest of the three "The Lieutenant of Dol Guldur". A large force of players confronts the Lieutenant and his Fell Beast at the chief tower of Dol Guldur.

column1: :During their travel down the waters of the Great River
column2: Legolas shot and killed a fell shadow in the sky
column3: not knowing it to be a Nazgûl. The player is later able to find the corpse of the fell beast in the Brown Lands and it becomes clear that a Nazgûl is not far - only this time the player cannot receive help from Elrond or Galadriel
column4: who helped him survive the last two encounters. At night
column6: but the player manages to drive him away with the use of fire. A girl named Nona is wounded in this fight
column7: but the Free Peoples managed to bring her to Lady Galadriel in time to heal the wound. The player later meets the Bane of Rhun in the Blackroot Vale and the Black Blade of Lebennin in Osgiliath. When Minas Tirith is attacked
column8: the Witch-King breaks the gate with Grond (battering ram).

column1: 2009: The Lord of the Rings: Conquest:
:In the Evil Campaign
column2: the Eight Nazgûl bring Witch-King back to life after Sauron reclaims The One Ring.

column1: 2011: The Lord of the Rings: War in the North:
:The Nazgûl appear in a flasback during the prologue of the game
column2: in which they attack the Rangers of the North at Sarn Ford
column3: the entrance of the Shire. Later in the flashback their leader
column5: speaks with Agandaûr.The Lord of the Rings: War in the North

column1: 2012-14: The Hobbit (film series):
:In the context of the film adaptation
column2: the Witch-king and the other Ringwraiths were buried in a dungeon in the High Fells of Rhudaur after the Battle of Fornost of Angmar. The Witch-king of Angmar initially appears in Dol Guldur
column3: where he briefly fights Radagast (who also discovers a Sauron#Saurons Return within the fortress) with his Morgul-blade. He drops it and  Radagast takes it with him
column5: who then shows to the White Council in Rivendell. Later
column8: visits the High Fells dungeons and discovers that they had been brought back to life
column10: broken open from the inside. Through this investigation
column11: he is convinced that the Necromancer is indeed Sauron.

column1: :During the Attack on Dol Guldur they appeared in armored
column2: ghostly versions of their mortal forms after Galadriel rescues Gandalf From his cage in Dol Guldur. The Nine do battle with Galadriel
column4: and Elrond. During a confrontation between Galadriel and Sauron
column6: with their master eventually following suit.
